column2: Divine Succession
Divine Succession

Succession to the Chrysanthemum Throne is limited to patrilineal descendants from Tenno Jimmu that still are part of the Imperial Family, with the heir being selected based on the approval of members from the Imperial Family and certain other influential people.
Divine Succession
Divine Succession

Succession is limited to the divine descendants sharing the current ruler's dynasty, with the heir being selected based on the approval of members of the ruling dynasty and certain other influential people.
Chinese Succession
Chinese Succession

Though the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven certainly can have a preferred heir various other parties sometimes wield enough influence to ensure that the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven is succeeded by someone else.
Fraternal Seniority
Fraternal Seniority
The throne passes to the next oldest eligible sibling, based on gender law preference. Let anyone who speaks against this succession principle be put to death!
Regency Power
Controls the influence of the Permanent Regent. These laws are passed using regular decisions.
Minimal

The Permanent Regent has very limited authority.
- The Permanent Regent may use a targeted decision to marry an adult male liege to a member of their dynasty, demoting any existing spouse to the rank of consort.
- The Permanent Regent has considerable influence in their liege's succession by virtue of being the Permanent Regent, and the liege's influence is reduced by virtue of having a Permanent Regency.
- The Permanent Regent's influence in their liege's succession increases with each Regency Power law passed, and their liege's influence decreases with each Regency Power law passed.
Minor

The Permanent Regent has slightly more authority.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can, if duke-tier or above, transfer count-tier vassals from their liege using a targeted decision targeting the vassal.
-As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can, if duke-tier or above, transfer count-tier vassals from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a targeted decision targeting the vassal. The Tenno's Permanent Regent cannot be transferred.
- Members of the Permanent Regent's dynasty that either are count-tier or above or that are close relatives of the Permanent Regent can no longer be fired by the Permanent Regent's liege.
Limited

Though the Permanent Regent has been given some authority it is still fairly limited.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can use a title decision to transfer counties from their liege. The liege's capital county cannot be transferred, nor Yamashiro if the liege possesses the Chrysanthemum Throne.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can transfer counties from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a title decision. Their respective capital counties cannot be transferred, nor can Yamashiro be transferred if it is held by the Tenno.
- The Permanent Regent can release their liege's prisoners using a targeted decision found on the prisoner.
Average

Most people would agree that the Permanent Regent neither has significant power nor has particularly limited power.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can transfer a significant amount of money from their liege's treasury, using a regular decision.
- The Permanent Regent can, if king-tier, transfer duke-tier vassals from their liege using a targeted decision targeting the vassal.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can, if king-tier, transfer duke-tier vassals from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a targeted decision targeting the vassal. The Tenno's Permanent Regent cannot be transferred.
Expanded

The Permanent Regent's powers have been expanded considerably.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can use a title decision to transfer duchies from their liege, assuming the liege is at least king-tier. Religious titles cannot be transferred.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can transfer duchies from the Tenno and the Tenno's Permanent Regent using a title decision. The Permanent Regent's primary title cannot be transferred.
- The Permanent Regent's liege is no longer allowed to fire any member of the Permanent Regent's dynasty from the council.
Major

The Permanent Regent's authority is quite significant indeed.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can execute their liege's prisoners using a targeted decision found on the prisoner. The liege's dynasty members cannot be targeted.
- The Permanent Regent can fire their liege's council members using a targeted decision found on the council member.
Unparalleled

The Permanent Regent's authority has never been greater than it currently is.
- Powers granted to the Permanent Regent at previous tiers are still available.
- The Permanent Regent can use a title decision to transfer kingdoms from their liege, assuming the liege holds an emperor-tier title. The Chrysanthemum Throne cannot be transferred.
- As long as the Tenno has a Permanent Regency, the Shogun's Permanent Regent can transfer kingdoms from the Tenno using a title decision. The Chrysanthemum Throne cannot be transferred.
- The Permanent Regent can use a decision to force their liege into an even more restrictive regency for a year.
Eunuch influence
Controls the number of Council Eunuchs and the amount of influence they possess.
No Eunuchs
The eunuchs are in their rightful place: Out of sight, out of mind.\n- No Council Eunuch positions are available.
Eunuchs Insignificant
The sole representative for the eunuchs on the council can most likely be safely ignored.\n- One Council Eunuch position is available.
Eunuchs Average

The eunuchs are making their presence felt on the council, but their support is not always necessary.\n- Four Council Eunuch positions are available.\n- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Good, outside special circumstances.
Eunuchs Significant

The support of at least a few of the eunuchs is most likely required for anything to be approved by the council.
- Eight Council Eunuch positions are available.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Average, outside special circumstances.
- Council Eunuchs cannot be fired.
Eunuchs Overwhelming

The influence of the eunuchs has not been greater since the days of the Ten Attendants. Their will be done.
- Twelve Council Eunuch positions are available.
- The Council Eunuchs have additional succession influence.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Poor, outside special circumstances.
- Council Eunuchs cannot be fired.
Grand Chancellor influence
Controls the extent of the Grand Chancellor's influence and power.
Grand Chancellor Decent
The Grand Chancellor is reasonably influential.\n- The Grand Chancellor is as weak as possible.\n- The Grand Chancellor gets a discount on all Boons.
Grand Chancellor Significant

The Grand Chancellor has more influence than many would say is proper.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Good, outside special circumstances.
- The Grand Chancellor can freely create duchy titles.
- The Grand Chancellor gets a discount on all Boons.
- The Grand Chancellor's advice is to be considered when accepting or refusing Tributes and Boons.
Grand Chancellor Overwhelming

The Grand Chancellor's influence is such that many feel that a comparison with the likes of Cao Cao or Dong Zhuo would be quite fitting.
- The Grand Chancellor is very powerful.
- The Grand Chancellor has additional succession influence.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Average, outside special circumstances.
- The Grand Chancellor can freely create duchy and kingdom titles.
- The Grand Chancellor gets a discount on all Boons.
- The Grand Chancellor's advice is to be considered when accepting or refusing Tributes and Boons.
- The Grand Chancellor may freely join the Claimant, Takeover, Council Power, and Independence factions.
Court influence
Controls the amount of influence wielded by courtiers that are not Council Eunuchs.
Courtiers Insignificant
Members of the court are largely unable to influence the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.
Courtiers Limited
Various members of the court formally have some influence, but for most it is only ceremonial.
Courtiers Average

While the amount of influence wielded by members of the court does not please everyone, many would say it is at a reasonable level.\n- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Good, outside special circumstances.
Courtiers Significant

Courtiers on the council have a significant amount of influence.\n- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Average, outside special circumstances.\n- Unlanded non-Council Eunuch councillors cannot be fired.
Courtiers Overwhelming

Several members of the court are exceptionally influential, much to the dislike of those that hold land within the realm.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Poor, outside special circumstances.
- Unlanded non-Council Eunuch councillors cannot be fired.
- Unlanded characters can now serve on the council even if not particularly skilled.
- If unlanded, the ruler's spouse, titled consorts, parents, and grandparents have additional succession influence.
Vassal influence
Controls the amount of influence wielded by vassals, as well as various laws limiting their powers.
Vassals Controlled

Vassals are held on a short leash, as is only right and proper.
- Vassals may not declare wars.
- Titles may not be inherited outside the realm.
- Duchy and kingdom viceroyalties are allowed.
- Vassals may not create duchies or kingdoms.
- The ruler is allowed to revoke titles.\-n Centralization can be increasd to Centralized.
- Vassal councillors can be fired, regardless of power.
Vassals Weak

Some minor concessions have been made by the central government, mainly in the name of reducing the amount of work required of various government ministers.
- Vassals may only declare external wars.
- Titles may not be inherited outside the realm.
- Duchy and kingdom viceroyalties are allowed.
- Vassals may not create kingdoms.
- The ruler is allowed to revoke titles.\-n Centralization can be increasd to High.
- Vassal councillors can be fired, regardless of power.
Vassals Average

Further authority has been delegated to vassals, most likely not to the liking of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Good, outside special circumstances.
- Vassals may only declare external wars.
- Titles may not be inherited outside the realm.
- Kingdom viceroyalties are allowed.
- Vassals may not create kingdoms.
- The ruler is allowed to revoke titles.\-n Centralization can be increasd to Medium.
- Vassal councillors can be fired, regardless of power.
Vassals Strong

The central government is no longer in a position to recover land held by vassals save by inheritance, and titles can only be granted in a hereditary fashion.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Average, outside special circumstances.
- Vassals may freely declare war.
- Titles may not be inherited outside the realm.
- No viceroyalties are allowed.
- Vassals may not create kingdoms.
- The ruler is not allowed to revoke titles.\-n Centralization can be increasd to Low.
- Powerful vassals on the council cannot be fired.
- Powerful vassals can serve on the council regardless of skill.
Vassals Unrestrained

The bureaucratic structure of the realm has all but collapsed, quite possibly a sign interesting times lie ahead.
- The Mandate of Heaven rating of the [This.Holder.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven cannot be increased above Poor, outside special circumstances.
- Vassals may freely declare war.
- Powerful vassals have additional succession influence.
- Titles may be inherited outside the realm.
- No viceroyalties are allowed.
- Vassals may create kingdoms and duchies.
- The ruler is not allowed to revoke titles.\-n Centralization can be increasd to Decentralized.
- Vassals on the council cannot be fired.
- Vassals can serve on the council regardless of skill.
No Council Eunuchs
One Council Eunuch
Four Council Eunuchs
Eigh Council Eunuchs
Twelve Council Eunuchs
Council Eunuchs cannot be fired
Council Eunuchs have additional succession influence
The Grand Chancellor can create duchies, even if regular vassals cannot
The Grand Chancellor can create kingdoms, even if regular vassals cannot
The Grand Chancellor has an easier time using several Grace decisions, if under China
The Grand Chancellor can advise the Dragon Throne on whether to accept or refuse Tributes and Boons, if under China
Ignoring the Grand Chancellor's advice on Grace-related matters makes the council discontent and is considered an act of tyranny
The Grand Chancellor is relatively weak
The Grand Chancellor is very powerful
The Grand Chancellor can freely join Claimant, Takeover, Council Power, and Independence factions

Courtiers on the council cannot be fired (excluding Council Eunuchs)
Courtiers can be appointed to the council regardless of skill
Spouses, concubines with special consort titles, and unlanded parents and grandparents of the ruler have additional succession influence
Centralization cannot be increased above Decentralized
Centralization cannot be increased above Low

Powerful vassals cannot be fired from the council

Duchies cannot be granted as viceroyalties
Kingdoms can be granted as viceroyalties
Kingdoms cannot be granted as viceroyalties

Titles can be inherited outside the realm

Vassals can declare external wars

Vassals can declare internal wars

Titles cannot be revoked
Vassals cannot create duchies
Vassals can create duchies
Vassals cannot create kingdoms
Vassals can create kingdoms
Powerful vassals can be councillors regardless of skill
Powerful vassals on the council have additional succession influence
